summary: This bill, the Universal Prekindergarten and Early Childhood Education Act of 2025, proposes a grant program administered by the Secretary of Education to assist states in establishing or expanding universal prekindergarten programs. States can apply for grants and must use funds to provide full-day programs for 3- and 4-year-olds in public schools, taught by qualified teachers. The federal government will cover up to 80% of the program's costs, supplementing existing federal education funds. Appropriations are authorized for fiscal years 2026-2031.
